discussion.content: If we want to use Wireshark to capture the Wi-Fi traffic (the 802.11 protocol packets) we need to purchase an external USB adapter like AirPcap that captures the WLANairpcap frames and delivers this data to Wireshark. When using AirPcap, Wireshark displays a special toolbar that provides direct control of the external wireless adapter during packet capture.

questions.question_text: You want to analyze packets on your wireless network. Which program would you use?

Jimmy is standing outside a secure entrance to a facility. He is pretending to have a tense conversation on his cell phone as an authorized employee badges in.
Jimmy, while still on the phone, grabs the door as it begins to close.
What just happened?

discussion.content: Whaling is phishing with highly ranked persons (Executives / CEO / other influential persons) as target. Simple think about trying to phish big fishes :-)

choices.C: An authentication system that creates one-time passwords that are encrypted with secret keys.
choices.B: A biometric system that bases authentication decisions on physical attributes.
choices.D: An authentication system that uses passphrases that are converted into virtual passwords.
choices.A: A biometric system that bases authentication decisions on behavioral attributes.

questions.question_text: Todd has been asked by the security officer to purchase a counter-based authentication system. Which of the following best describes this type of system?

discussion.content: In Counter-based tokens, both the token and the authenticating server maintain a counter, whose value besides a shared secret key are used to generate the one-time password. This type of tokens requires one or more actions from the user before generating and displaying the one-time password

choices.B: Modifying and replaying captured network traffic
choices.A: Identifying operating systems, services, protocols and devices
choices.D: Capturing a network traffic for further analysis
choices.C: Collecting unencrypted information about usernames and passwords

questions.question_text: When conducting a penetration test, it is crucial to use all means to get all available information about the target network. One of the ways to do that is by sniffing the network. Which of the following cannot be performed by the passive network sniffing?

comments.content: Not sure. Replaying traffic on the network does not mean that you need to interact with the target. Plus questions says what can you do with the network traffic sniffed? You can modify and replay it which is also the reason most firewalls and VPN solutions support anti-replay
You can still sniff passively then do a replay attack actively, replay attack does not make sniffing active retroactively.

discussion.content:
Passive sniffing is not having any direct interaction or it would be considered active sniffing
Modifying and replaying captured traffic would be considered active because you will be directly interacting with the target(s)

choices.D: Lockout accounts under brute force password cracking attempts

questions.question_text: How can rainbow tables be defeated?

discussion.content: In cryptography, a salt is random data that is used as an additional input to a one-way function that hashes data, a password or passphrase. Salts are used to safeguard passwords in storage. Historically a password was stored in plaintext on a system, but over time additional safeguards were developed to protect a user's password against being read from the system. A salt is one of those methods.
